title: 学ぶ、破る - learn to break

messages.content: what is the Japanese concept meaning learn by rules, perfect it, then break it

The Japanese concept you are referring to is "破るために学ぶ" or "yaburu tame ni manabu", which translates to "learn in order to break" or "learn in order to transcend." 

This concept is often applied in traditional Japanese arts such as calligraphy, tea ceremony, and martial arts. It suggests that one should first learn the rules and techniques thoroughly and strive for perfection, but once that level of mastery is achieved, one can then go beyond the rules and express their own creativity and individuality by breaking or bending them.

In other words, by first mastering the rules and techniques, one gains the knowledge and skill necessary to create something new and innovative, while still maintaining a foundation in the traditional methods.
